definition: far/distant/remote/(intensifier in a comparison) by far/much (lower etc)

sentences.english: If heaven is a million years away, oh just call me and I make your day.
sentences.chinese: 縱使路途遙遠千年萬年，我也必定將你帶入那片天堂。

sentences.english: Even if a long journey, I will follow the love you left, Keep on moving.
sentences.chinese: 即使路途遙遠，俺也會跟隨着你留下地愛，繼續前行。

sentences.english: He faced the long drive home with dread.
sentences.chinese: 回家的路途遙遠，他心裏有些害怕。

sentences.english: It's far; hundreds and hundreds of kilometers.
The distance with not feeling well, go home easier said than done.
sentences.chinese: 路途遙遠加上身體不適，回家談何容易。

sentences.english: Therefore, I think it should not travel by train if it's far.
sentences.chinese: 所以，我覺得路途遙遠的話就不要坐火車旅行。

sentences.english: The clothes and sandals that we use have worn out because of the very long journey.
sentences.chinese: 這是我們的衣服和鞋，爲了路途遙遠，都穿爛了。

definition: to hasten on with one's journey/to hurry on
to take the car, bus, train etc
lit. flower viewing from horseback (idiom); fig. superficial understanding from cursory observation/to make a quick judgment based on inadequate information
to pass over mountains ridges (idiom); fig. hardships of the journey
to ride (a bicycle, horse, motorbike etc)/cycling/horseback riding/motorbike riding/a ride/CL:次[ci4]
to ride (in a vehicle)/to get a lift/to hitch-hike
to go on a journey/to leave
to leave one's native place, esp. against one's will (idiom)
to go abroad/to leave the country/emigration
to transfer/to change trains, buses etc
